attributes.action: Get cctv put in the area for the safety of residents
attributes.additional_details: To make everyone in the community to feel safe and to hopefully stop all the anti social behaviour as residents are fed up with it & we want to be heard
attributes.background: We want someone to actually listen and put in cctv in the area surrounding all blocks & houses

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about installation of CCTV on local roads are a matter for individual local authorities and landowners, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
